body:
Comment 2: 
As I understand the argument, T.m is a clear syntactic reference to the method, and so
the cycle is observable.  T{}.m is not a clear syntactic reference, since determining
which method is involved requires doing type checking to determine that the type of T{}
is T, which is not an interface type, and therefore the method is known.  The spec is
trying to say that initialization loops are detected purely syntactically, so finding a
loop should not require type checking.

That argument seems plausible to me, so I am closing this bug.
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
